titles.title: A bill to amend the Archeological Resources Protection Act of 1979 to prohibit attempted excavation, removal, or defacing, and to reduce the felony threshold value of illegally removed artifacts to $500.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Interior Department, OMB.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Agriculture Department.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources received executive comment from Agriculture Department. Favorable.
Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks. Hearings held.

committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 6/3/1987--Introduced. Amends the Archeological Resources Protection Act of 1979 to prohibit attempted excavation, removal, damage, alteration, or defacing of artifacts. Reduces the felony threshold value of illegally removed artifacts to $500.
